items.title: Police hunt Epping migrant sex offender released in error
items.description: Hadush Kebatu, whose arrest triggered protests in Essex, is now "at large" in London, the justice secretary says.

items.title: Watch: Video appears to show asylum seeker after accidental release from prison
items.description: A video shared online appears to show Hadush Gerberslasie Kebatu walking along Chelmsford high street.

items.title: Venezuela's Maduro says US 'fabricating war' as it deploys world's largest warship
items.description: The deployment of the USS Gerald R Ford marks a major escalation in what the US says is a campaign to target drug traffickers.

items.title: Gaza children dying as they wait for Israel to enable evacuations
items.description: Around 15,000 Gazans are waiting for urgent medical treatment, according to the UN.

items.title: Reeves should not cut cash ISA allowance, MPs say
items.description: The Chancellor is reportedly trying to revive plans to cut the tax-free limit for Cash ISAs.

items.title: As Strictly is back on screens, bookies take bets on new Tess and Claudia
items.description: The couples will take to the floor for Icons Week after the show's presenters announced they are leaving.

items.title: Magnesium: Can this 'miracle mineral' really help us sleep?
items.description: The global market in this supplement is worth almost £3bn - a figure set to nearly double over the next decade.

items.title: Britney Spears said she was used. Kevin Federline says she needs help
items.description: Decades later, the pop star's very public unravelling is back in the limelight - but what exactly happened and why depends on who is doing the retelling.

items.title: 'I just love yapping': Spud sellers, posh-girl comedy and bus-loving gran among  TikTok award nominees
items.description: There are 72 nominees in total, who have a combined following of more than 83 million followers.

items.title: What is driving the decision to learn in a manual or automatic car?
items.description: Learner drivers say a lack of automatic instructors and the higher cost of lessons pushes them to manual.

items.title: How to cope with long winter nights when the clocks go back
items.description: More than a million people in the UK experience symptoms of Seasonal Affective Disorder - but a project is aiming to help people in Orkney look after their mental health.

items.title: Irish presidential election count under way
items.description: Catherine Connolly and Heather Humphreys wait to find out who will replace Michael D Higgins and become Ireland's 10th president.

items.title: 'One out... by mistake' and Prince Andrew 'dislodged'
items.description: The fallout after a former asylum seeker who assaulted a 14-year-old girl was mistakenly released from prison leads the papers.

items.title: Ukraine allies pledge to take Russian oil and gas off global market
items.description: A "coalition of the willing" meeting in London seeks to increase pressure on Russia to end its war in Ukraine.

items.title: Reeves refuses to rule out income tax rises in Budget
items.description: Chancellors rarely reveal tax plans before the Budget, but Reeves has softened her language on raising income tax.

items.title: Attacks on people like me happen every time my country has an election
items.description: The false belief that body parts of people with albinism bring wealth or luck have driven attacks.

items.title: Chief prosecutor says top official would not call China an enemy
items.description: Stephen Parkinson sets out why the case against two alleged spies was dropped in a letter to MPs.

items.title: Watch: 'Incredible surprise' as curious dolphin joins kayakers for a paddle
items.description: The nosey creature swam with them as they paddled under the Forth Rail Bridge in the Firth of Forth.

items.title: US chatshow host Jimmy Fallon borrows kilt for dinner with soldiers in Scotland
items.description: The US comedian was invited to dinner at the Victoria Barracks in Ballater by members of 5Scots regiment.

items.title: Bears ‘enjoy life to the full’ after being rescued from bus depot
items.description: The bears were living in a bus depot in Armenia to entertain travellers when they were saved in 2018.

items.title: Pen pals meet for the first time after 43 years
items.description: The two women began exchanging letters in 1983 through a school project and finally met in Newfoundland this week.

items.title: The cafe owner putting phones in ‘jail’ to encourage chatting
items.description: Usman Hussain wants people to interact with each other more, instead of being glued to their phones.

items.title: BBC News app
items.description: Top stories, breaking news, live reporting, and follow news topics that match your interests

items.title: 'They're in trouble' - West Ham make worst start in 52 years
items.description: West Ham's miserable Premier League campaign continues with a defeat at Leeds on Friday which ensured their worst start to a season for 52 years.

items.title: Why 'cheat code' Farnworth can light up Ashes for England
items.description: Lancashire lad Herbie Farnworth is an NRL star - now he hopes to inspire England to success in three Tests against world champions Australia.

items.title: McLaren 'already behind' as Verstappen sets practice pace
items.description: Red Bull driver Max Verstappen goes fastest in the second practice session at the Mexico City Grand Prix.

items.title: Can Bellingham make El Clasico statement with English sub-plot?
items.description: As Jude Bellingham prepares to face England team-mate Marcus Rashford in El Clasico, BBC Sport looks at why it could be a defining match for the Real Madrid midfielder.

items.title: Leeds earn big win to heap more misery on West Ham
items.description: Leeds secure their first Premier League win at home since their opening game in August and pile on the problems for second-bottom West Ham.

items.title: England's Kildunne wins on club return in 14-try PWR opener
items.description: England World cup stars Ellie Kildunne and Lucy Packer make a winning return to club rugby as Harlequins beat Loughborough Lightning in a stunning, 14-try Premiership Women's Rugby opener at The Stoop.

items.title: Watch: The Bodies in the Suitcases
items.description: A chilling discovery on a Bristol bridge exposes a twisted tale of sex, lies, and murder.

items.title: The week: A historic by-election, Prince Andrew and digital ID
items.description: Plaid Cymru wins historic by-election beating out Reform and Labour.

items.title: How Giorgia Meloni became Trump's best friend in Europe
items.description: A populist whose party has roots in Italian fascism, Italy's leader is trusted by Trump.

items.title: Some of music history’s most shocking stories revealed
